oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A history of the town of Amherst, New York, 1818-1965
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A History of the Town of Amherst, N.Y., 1818-1965, was published by the Town of Amherst in 1965 and written by the Town Clerk and Town Historian, Sue Miller Young. A descendent of some of Amhersts oldest families, Mrs. Young was one of the founding members of the Williamsville Historical Society and an accomplished archer. This book, the first book-length definitive history of the Town of Amherst, has been out of print for quite some time and is therefore in frequent demand by local historians and genealogists.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Young, Sue Miller, 1886-1967
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Amherst (N.Y.)--History; Amherst (N.Y. : Town)--History; New York (State)--History; New York (State), Western--History
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: New York (State), Western; Erie County (N.Y.); Amherst (N.Y.); Amherst (N.Y. : Town)
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: xx, 306 p., [32] p. of plates : ill., maps, ports. ; 24 cm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: History of the Town of Amherst, New York, 1818-1965
